item.title: Burning tokens
item.description: [[web3/solidity/erc721-ownership-transfer|Transferring]] a token to an address of 0 is basically sending it to a wallet no one has the private key for, esentially making it unrecoverable.

item.title: ERC721 standard
item.description: ERC721 tokens are not interchangeable and not divisable. Each once is assumed to be unique (they have a unique ID). You can only trade them as a whole units.

item.title: eth_accounts
item.description: eth_accounts is a special method that is used to see if you are authorized to access any of the accounts in the [[web3/crypto-wallet]].

item.title: eth_requestAccounts
item.description: eth_requestAccounts function is used to ask the [[web3/crypto-wallet]] to give the dApp the access to the user’s wallet.

item.title: gas fee
item.description: In [[Ethereum network]] the gas is a fuel the [[dApps]] run on. Every time the user executes a function on a [[Ethereum network]], he has to pay for it in ETH.

item.title: Goerli Testnet
item.description: Görli Testnet is a testing [[Ethereum network]] run by Ethereum Foundation for testing the [[web3/smart-contracts]] being developed for free.
